activity.content: @willpienaar cool. The fat client will likely be deployed in a serverless env. (lambda, etc.)  - so not too fat, or can't use it. Other popular LLM projects fail this test and are unusable for cheap scale-out.

If the next version of GPT is a leap in performance as GPT-4 was I think fine tuning becomes a thing of the past

Current GPT-4 can go up to 32k context length, what would it mean if the next version did 64k or higher?

Your vertical domain specific model would be one prompt away

@abacaj Being able to tune in a more continuous space is critical to build many experiences where we don’t know what to prompt but have various forms of feedback.  Fine tuning the entire model is likely not necessary but moving beyond text seems like an obvious win for many applications.

activity.content: Excited to announce RoboDesk, a multi-task, pixel-based reinforcement learning benchmark that features 9 diverse tasks in the same environment. The tasks test for a wide variety of robotic skills and involve multiple interactive objects (drawers, buttons, various blocks). 🤖👇 https://t.co/PCAXAaT5EO

RoboDesk comes as a self-contained Python package with few dependencies. The source code is clean and pragmatic, making it a useful blueprint for creating new MuJoCo environments.

pip install robodesk

More info: https://t.co/tisnSTF0iL

(cc @danijarh @chelseabfinn @doomie)
activity.parent_content: We carefully designed and tested RoboDesk to ensure fast and stable physics simulation. This avoids objects from intersecting, getting stuck, or quickly flying away, common problems that can occur with multi-object environments.
